page.title: 18The Market
page.content: The market in Castle Douglas in its present form was founded in 1933, and is owned by a public company run by a board of directors. The market itself extends over 6 acres and it also owns 110 acres of land. It has 3 main sale rings and 9 other covered areas for cattle and sheep. The market employs 21 full time workers. It has over 500 pens which are used for cattle and sheep. There is an average of 2 sales a week. Buyers come from North Aberdeen to South Lincolnshire. The highest price paid for any animal was for a Galloway Bull, Â£14,175 in 1960; in 1984 Â£9,000 was paid for a black-faced ram lamb. The wierdest thing the market has sold is a 5 legged sheep.
